# Welcome {.unnumbered}

## UArizona Data7 Exploratory Data Analysis In R Workshops Companion Book!

Here you will find a collection of Exploratory Data Analysis in R Workshops prepared by the staff of the [Data Science Institute](https://datascience.arizona.edu/)

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## [Exploratory data analysis in R - Diagnosing like a data doctor](https://github.com/Gchism94/Data7_EDA_In_R_Workshops/tree/main/EDA_In_R_Summer1)

### Purpose of Workshop

Exploring a novel data set and produce publication quality tables and reports

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## [Exploratory data analysis in R - Exploring like a data adventurer](https://github.com/Gchism94/Data7_EDA_In_R_Workshops/tree/main/EDA_In_R_Summer2)

### Purpose of the Workshop

Exploring the normality of numerical columns in a novel data set and producing publication quality tables and reports

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## [Exploratory Data Analysis in R - Transforming like a Data... Transformer](https://github.com/Gchism94/Data7_EDA_In_R_Workshops/tree/main/Workshops/Fall2022/EDA_In_R_Fall3)

### Purpose of the Workshop

Using data transformation to correct non-normality in numerical data

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## [Exploratory Data Analysis in R - Imputating like a Data Scientist](https://github.com/Gchism94/Data7_EDA_In_R_Workshops/tree/main/Workshops/Fall2022/EDA_In_R_Fall4)

### Purpose of the Workshop

Exploring, visualizing, and imputing outliers and missing values (NAs) in a novel data set and produce publication quality graphs and tables

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## [Exploratory Data Analysis in R - Correlate Like a Data Master](https://github.com/Gchism94/Data7_EDA_In_R_Workshops/tree/main/Workshops/Fall2022/EDA_In_R_Fall5)

### Purpose of the Workshop

Assess relationships within a novel data set using publication quality tables and plots
